name: corner
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the point, area, or line that is formed by the meeting of two lines, surfaces, roads, etc.

example.eg: You go around corners too fast when you're driving!
There's a postbox on the corner (= the place where the street crosses another).
Click the icon in the bottom right-hand corner of the screen.
example.egtrans: 点击屏幕右下方的图标。

example.eg: I have a bruise where I hit my leg on the corner of the table.
example.egtrans: 我的腿撞到桌角上，起了一块淤青。

example.eg: They live just around/round the corner (= very close although not in the same road) - so we see them all the time.
example.egtrans: 他们就住在附近——所以我们常看见他们。

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of a larger area, often somewhere quiet or far away
trans_examp.trans_cn: 角落，冷僻处；边远处；隐蔽的地方

example.eg: They live in a remote corner of Scotland, miles from the nearest store.
example.egtrans: 他们住在苏格兰一个边远的角落，离最近的商店也有几十英里。

trans_examp.trans_en: a kick in football or a shot in hockey that is taken from the corner of the playing area

name: corner
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: corner
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If a vehicle corners well, badly, etc., it drives around corners in the stated way.

example.eg: It's a powerful car, but it doesn't corner well.
example.egtrans: 这辆车马力强劲，但转弯性能欠佳。

dsense.name: corner
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to force a person or an animal into a place or situation from which they cannot easily escape
trans_examp.trans_cn: 将（人或动物）逼入困境；使陷入绝境，使走投无路

example.eg: Once the police had cornered her in the basement, she gave herself up.
example.egtrans: 一旦警察把她困在地下室里，她便束手就擒了。
